perturbation.original_text: The following definitions and interpretations shall apply to certain terms used in this Agreement:   (a) Affiliate: A company is the Affiliate of another if either company owns directly or indirectly less than 50% but no less than 10% of its equity.
perturbation.changed_text: The following definitions and interpretations shall apply to certain terms used in this Agreement:   (a) Affiliate: A company is the Affiliate of another if either company owns directly or indirectly less than 50% but no less than 10% of its equity. In some cases, the term 'Associated Entity' may be used to refer to the same concept.
perturbation.explanation: The introduction of 'Associated Entity' as potentially interchangeable with 'Affiliate', without a clear definition of 'Associated Entity', creates ambiguity. The document now suggests two potentially different meanings for the same relationship, leading to confusion about obligations and rights tied to Affiliates.

perturbation.original_text: The costs associated with the operation and maintenance duties (herein called the "O&M Costs") are the costs reasonably incurred in the operation and maintenance of Segment S and Segment T including, but not limited to:   (a) the cost of attendance, testing, adjustments, repairs and replacements, cable ships, (including standby costs), cable depots, maintenance and repair devices that are or may hereafter become available, customs duties, taxes, (except income tax imposed on the net income of a Party) paid in respect of such facilities, billing activities, financial charges attributable to other Parties, shares of costs incurred by a Terminal Parties, supervision, overheads and costs and expenses reasonably incurred on account of claims made by or against other persons in respect of such facilities or any part thereof and damages or compensation payable by the Parties concerned on account of such claims;
perturbation.changed_text: The costs associated with the operation and maintenance duties (herein called the "O&M Costs") or 'Service Expenditures' are the costs reasonably incurred in the operation and maintenance of Segment S and Segment T including, but not limited to:   (a) the cost of attendance, testing, adjustments, repairs and replacements, cable ships, (including standby costs), cable depots, maintenance and repair devices that are or may hereafter become available, customs duties, taxes, (except income tax imposed on the net income of a Party) paid in respect of such facilities, billing activities, financial charges attributable to other Parties, shares of costs incurred by a Terminal Parties, supervision, overheads and costs and expenses reasonably incurred on account of claims made by or against other persons in respect of such facilities or any part thereof and damages or compensation payable by the Parties concerned on account of such claims;
perturbation.explanation: Here, 'Service Expenditures' is added as a term that is interchangeable with 'O&M Costs', but is never defined. This creates uncertainty whether all O&M Costs are service expenditures, or if service expenditures include a different set of expenses. This affects cost allocation responsibilities.

perturbation.original_text: Capacity of APCN 2 can only be used by a carrier.   12.2 Parties shall obtain Allocated Capacity in the form of MIU on an ownership basis as shown in Schedule C, in return for their financial investment as identified in Schedule B.
perturbation.changed_text: Capacity of APCN 2 can only be used by a carrier. However, bandwidth can be provisioned to other entities. 12.2 Parties shall obtain Allocated Capacity in the form of MIU on an ownership basis as shown in Schedule C, in return for their financial investment as identified in Schedule B.
perturbation.explanation: The introduction of 'bandwidth' as another term for capacity or similar, but undefined, creates an internal contradiction. The initial sentence states capacity is *only* for carriers, but then implies other entities can get access to bandwidth, which is not explained if that is different from capacity. Is ‘bandwidth’ capacity, or a part of it? This causes confusion.
